pueblosmagicos.name: Tulum, Quintana Roo
pueblosmagicos.description: Ancient walled Mayan city facing the Caribbean Sea, with a white sand beach and turquoise waters.

pueblosmagicos.name: Real de Catorce, San Luis Potosi
pueblosmagicos.description: Ghost mining town surrounded by desert mountains, known for its colonial architecture and silver mines.

pueblosmagicos.name: Mazamitla, Jalisco
pueblosmagicos.description: Charming town with colonial-style architecture, surrounded by pine and oak forests.

pueblosmagicos.name: Valle de Bravo, State of Mexico
pueblosmagicos.description: Picturesque town on the shore of a lake, famous for its tile-roofed houses and tranquil atmosphere.

pueblosmagicos.name: Bacalar, Quintana Roo
pueblosmagicos.description: Town next to a lagoon of seven colors, with 18th-century military forts and a relaxed atmosphere.

pueblosmagicos.name: Pátzcuaro, Michoacán
pueblosmagicos.description: Charming colonial town around a main square, famous for its crafts and traditions.

pueblosmagicos.name: Tequila, Jalisco
pueblosmagicos.description: Famous town for being the birthplace of tequila, with historic distilleries and agave landscapes.

pueblosmagicos.name: San Cristóbal de las Casas, Chiapas
pueblosmagicos.description: Colonial town with cobblestone streets and historic buildings, surrounded by mountains and indigenous culture.

pueblosmagicos.name: Huasca de Ocampo, Hidalgo
pueblosmagicos.description: Magical town with colonial architecture, silver mines, and basaltic prism forests.

pueblosmagicos.name: Tepoztlán, Morelos
pueblosmagicos.description: Magical town known for its pyramid on top of a mountain and its spiritual atmosphere.

pueblosmagicos.name: Creel, Chihuahua
pueblosmagicos.description: Alpine town in the mountains of the Sierra Tarahumara, starting point for exploring Copper Canyon.

pueblosmagicos.name: Todos Santos, Baja California Sur
pueblosmagicos.description: Charming town on the Pacific coast, famous for its art and surf beaches.

pueblosmagicos.name: Malinalco, State of Mexico
pueblosmagicos.description: Historic town with a pyramid on top of a mountain, ideal for exploring history and nature.

pueblosmagicos.name: Cuetzalan, Puebla
pueblosmagicos.description: Magical town in the mountains of the Sierra Norte de Puebla, known for its indigenous culture and coffee.

pueblosmagicos.name: Papantla, Veracruz
pueblosmagicos.description: Town with Totonac roots, famous for its flyers and colonial architecture.

pueblosmagicos.name: Bernal, Querétaro
pueblosmagicos.description: Town at the foot of the third largest monolith in the world, ideal for outdoor activities and gastronomy.

pueblosmagicos.name: Tlayacapan, Morelos
pueblosmagicos.description: Charming town in the Tepoztlán mountains, famous for its architecture and gastronomy.

pueblosmagicos.name: Cosalá, Sinaloa
pueblosmagicos.description: Magical town with colonial architecture, silver mines, and waterfalls in the surroundings.

pueblosmagicos.name: Amealco, Querétaro
pueblosmagicos.description: Charming town in the Sierra Gorda de Querétaro, famous for its landscapes and crafts.

pueblosmagicos.name: Jerez de García Salinas, Zacatecas
pueblosmagicos.description: Charming town on the Zacatecas wine route, famous for its architecture and wine culture.

pueblosmagicos.name: Tapalpa, Jalisco
pueblosmagicos.description: Magical town in the mountains of Jalisco, known for its adobe architecture and natural landscapes.

pueblosmagicos.name: Coatepec, Veracruz
pueblosmagicos.description: Magical town in the mountains of Veracruz, famous for its coffee and colonial architecture.

pueblosmagicos.name: Parras de la Fuente, Coahuila
pueblosmagicos.description: Charming town in the Coahuila desert, famous for its wines and history.

pueblosmagicos.name: San Sebastián del Oeste, Jalisco
pueblosmagicos.description: Magical town in the mountains of Jalisco, famous for its colonial architecture and silver mines.

pueblosmagicos.name: Tula, Hidalgo
pueblosmagicos.description: Charming town in the state of Hidalgo, famous for its pyramids and pre-Hispanic history.

pueblosmagicos.name: Alamos, Sonora
pueblosmagicos.description: Magical town in the Sierra de Sonora, famous for its colonial architecture and tranquil atmosphere.

pueblosmagicos.name: Izamal, Yucatán
pueblosmagicos.description: Magical town in the state of Yucatán, famous for its yellow-painted buildings and Maya history.

playasmexico.name: Playa Cosala, Jalisco
playasmexico.description: Hidden gem near Puerto Vallarta, crystal-clear waters, lush vegetation.

playasmexico.name: Playa del Carmen, Quintana Roo
playasmexico.description: Popular beach destination with white sand and turquoise waters.

playasmexico.name: Tulum Beach, Quintana Roo
playasmexico.description: Stunning beach with Mayan ruins overlooking the Caribbean Sea.

playasmexico.name: Punta de Mita, Nayarit
playasmexico.description: Luxury resort area known for its beautiful beaches and upscale amenities.

playasmexico.name: Zipolite, Oaxaca
playasmexico.description: Famous for being one of Mexico's few nude beaches, relaxed atmosphere.

playasmexico.name: Mazatlan Beach, Sinaloa
playasmexico.description: Golden sandy beaches, lively atmosphere, rich in history and culture.

playasmexico.name: Puerto Ángel, Oaxaca
playasmexico.description: Quiet fishing village, beautiful beaches, perfect for relaxation.

playasmexico.name: Zihuatanejo Beach, Guerrero
playasmexico.description: Charming fishing village, beautiful beaches, laid-back atmosphere.

playasmexico.name: Balandra Beach, Baja California Sur
playasmexico.description: Pristine white sand beach, clear turquoise waters, great for families.

playasmexico.name: Chacala Beach, Nayarit
playasmexico.description: Small fishing village, calm waters, ideal for swimming and relaxing.

playasmexico.name: Sayulita Beach, Nayarit
playasmexico.description: Surfing hotspot, bohemian vibe, colorful shops and cafes.

playasmexico.name: Puerto Escondido, Oaxaca
playasmexico.description: World-class surfing destination, beautiful beaches, lively nightlife.

playasmexico.name: Playa Norte, Isla Mujeres
playasmexico.description: Crystal-clear waters, white sandy beaches, great for swimming and sunbathing.

playasmexico.name: Cabo Pulmo, Baja California Sur
playasmexico.description: National Marine Park, excellent diving and snorkeling spot, rich marine life.

playasmexico.name: Cozumel Beach, Quintana Roo
playasmexico.description: Island paradise, world-class diving and snorkeling, vibrant coral reefs.

playasmexico.name: Bucerias Beach, Nayarit
playasmexico.description: Charming town, beautiful beaches, relaxed atmosphere.

playasmexico.name: Acapulco Beach, Guerrero
playasmexico.description: Historic resort town, beautiful beaches, vibrant nightlife.

playasmexico.name: Ixtapa Beach, Guerrero
playasmexico.description: Modern resort area, beautiful beaches, wide range of water sports.

playasmexico.name: Holbox Beach, Quintana Roo
playasmexico.description: Island paradise, laid-back atmosphere, great for nature lovers.

playasmexico.name: Punta Mita, Nayarit
playasmexico.description: Exclusive resort area, stunning beaches, luxury accommodations.

playasmexico.name: Puerto Vallarta Beach, Jalisco
playasmexico.description: Vibrant beach town, beautiful beaches, lively nightlife.

playasmexico.name: Cancun Beach, Quintana Roo
playasmexico.description: Famous for its white sandy beaches and turquoise waters, bustling nightlife.

playasmexico.name: Los Cabos Beach, Baja California Sur
playasmexico.description: Luxury resort area, stunning beaches, world-class golfing.

playasmexico.name: San Pancho Beach, Nayarit
playasmexico.description: Charming town, beautiful beaches, laid-back atmosphere.

playasmexico.name: Playa del Amor, Jalisco
playasmexico.description: Hidden beach accessible only by boat, stunning natural beauty.

playasmexico.name: Troncones Beach, Guerrero
playasmexico.description: Secluded beach, perfect for relaxation and water sports.

playasmexico.name: Tulum Ruins Beach, Quintana Roo
playasmexico.description: Beautiful beach near the ancient Mayan ruins of Tulum, stunning views.

playasmexico.name: Manzanillo Beach, Colima
playasmexico.description: Beautiful beaches, perfect for water sports and relaxation.

playasmexico.name: Barra de Navidad Beach, Jalisco
playasmexico.description: Quaint beach town, beautiful beaches, relaxed atmosphere.

playasmexico.name: Punta Zicatela, Oaxaca
playasmexico.description: World-famous surfing beach, powerful waves, international surfing competitions.

playasmexico.name: Mismaloya Beach, Jalisco
playasmexico.description: Scenic beach, famous for its appearance in the movie 'The Night of the Iguana'.

playasmexico.name: Majahuitas Beach, Jalisco
playasmexico.description: Secluded beach, only accessible by boat, perfect for snorkeling and relaxation.
